<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of fast_simple_hash:
```c
static uint32_t
fast_simple_hash (const uint8_t *data,
                  size_t data_size)
{
  uint32_t hash;

  if (0 != data_size)
  {
    size_t i;
    hash = data[0];
    for (i = 1; i < data_size; i++)
      hash = _MHD_ROTL32 (hash, 7) ^ data[i];
  }
  else
    hash = 0;

  return hash;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
for (i = 1; i < data_size; i++)
      hash = _MHD_ROTL32 (hash, 7) ^ data[i];
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the loop calls _MHD_ROTL32 to rotate bits and does not call fast_simple_hash. There is no direct or indirect call from fast_simple_hash back to itself in the shown fragment. (Only if _MHD_ROTL32 itself called fast_simple_hash would an indirect recursion occur, but that is not the case for a normal rotate-left helper.)
